data: Newborn Critical Congenital Heart Disease (CCHD) Screening
As per Critical Congenital Heart Diseases (CCHD) Screening Tool - NICU Criteria and Timeframe
Retinopathy of Prematurity exam is to be done at 42 days of age for birth weight less than 1250g and/or less than 31+6 weeks
Reason: Retinopathy of Prematurity, Exam Location: Unit, Exam Type: Initial

The ideal time for the Newborn Screen is between 24 and 48 hours after birth.  This applies to both term and premature infants. Collect a second Newborn Screen Collection at Day 21 of life if infant is less than or equal to 1500 grams or received a blood transfusion prior to the first Newborn Screen Collection
Blood Spot, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood Spot, Routine, Unit collect, Collection: T+21;N, once
Saliva Swab, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once

*- For birth weight less than or equal to 1250g or gestational age less than 29 weeks, select US Head for Day 3 to 4, Day 10 to 14  and Day 42 and at term  
- For birth weight between 1250g to 1750g (routine), select US Head for Day 10 to 14  
- For birth weight between 1250g to 1750g  (with IVH III or IV, PVL, or ventricular dilatation), select US Head for Day 10 to 14, Day 42, and at Term or discharge if it's been more than 3 weeks since previous
Routine, Special Instructions: to be done on day 3 to 4 of life, Transport: Portable
Routine, Special Instructions: to be done on day 10 to 14 of life, Transport: Portable
Routine, Special Instructions: to be done on day 42 of life, Transport: Portable
Timed, Special Instructions: to be done at PMA greater than 37 weeks and if 3 weeks from previous US Head, Transport: Portable
